title: Princess Iniga of Thurn and Taxis
text:
Princess Iniga of Thurn and Taxis (<a href="German%20language">German</a> Iniga Anna Margarete Wilhelmine Luise, Prinzessin von Thurn und Taxis, 25 August 1925, Schloss Niederaichbach, <a href="Niederaichbach">Niederaichbach</a>, <a href="Bavaria">Bavaria</a>, Germany – 17 September 2008, <a href="Aufhausen">Aufhausen</a>, Germany) was a princess of the <a href="House%20of%20Thurn%20and%20Taxis">House of Thurn and Taxis</a> by birth and a <a href="Duke%20of%20Urach">Princess of Urach</a> through her marriage to Prince Eberhard von Urach, member of a <a href="morganatic%20marriage">morganatic</a> branch of the former royal <a href="House%20of%20W%C3%BCrttemberg">House of Württemberg</a> .
Family.
Iniga was the second child and only daughter of <a href="Prince%20Ludwig%20Philipp%20of%20Thurn%20and%20Taxis">Prince Ludwig Philipp of Thurn and Taxis</a> and his wife <a href="Princess%20Elisabeth%20of%20Luxembourg%20%281901%E2%80%931950%29">Princess Elisabeth of Luxembourg</a>.
Marriage and issue.
Iniga married Prince Eberhard von Urach (1907–1969), eighth child of <a href="Mindaugas%20II%20of%20Lithuania">Wilhelm, 2nd Duke von Urach</a> and his wife <a href="Duchess%20Amalie%20in%20Bavaria">Duchess Amalie in Bavaria</a>, civilly 18 May 1948 in Niederaichbach and religiously 20 May 1948 in Regensburg. Prince Eberhard served as a <a href="reconnaissance">reconnaissance</a> officer in 1938–44 and was promoted to <a href="Major%20%28Germany%29">major</a>. Iniga and Eberhard had issue:
After her father's death, Iniga inherited her father's estate "<a href="Schloss">Schloss</a>" Niederaichbach.
Death.
Iniga died on 17 September 2008 at her home in <a href="Aufhausen">Aufhausen</a>. A requiem and funeral were held at the Wallfahrtskirche St. Maria Himmelfahrt in Aufkirchen am Starnberger See on 23 September 2008. She was buried in the Friedhof Aufkirchen.
